Building Modern Web Applications with VueGo

By Jane Developer on November 14, 2025

VueGo combines the simplicity of Vue.js-style templates with the power of Go's template engine. This article explores how to leverage both for building dynamic, server-rendered applications.

Key Features

  • Server-Side Rendering : Render templates on the server for better SEO and initial load performance
  • Familiar Syntax : Use Vue.js-like directives (v-if, v-for, v-bind) that feel natural
  • Type Safety : Leverage Go's type system for robust template rendering

Getting Started

Follow these steps to begin:

  1. Install VueGo package with go get
  2. Create your first template with .vuego extension
  3. Set up data as a map[string]any
  4. Render using vue.Render()
  5. Enjoy your dynamic HTML!

Code Example

Here's a simple example:

    vue := vuego.NewVue(templateFS)
var buf bytes.Buffer
err := vue.Render(&buf, "page.vuego", data)
